attributes.comment:
It is my opinion that adoption is expensive enough already, and it is
unconscionable to raise fees by up to 66% for adoption-related petitions. It is
already questionable that a person who is trying to adopt an orphaned child must
re-file with the USCIS if their file becomes older than 12 months during the
adoption process. With the time-frames ever increasing and the average adoption
placement taking nearly 18-24 months, the USCIS is almost in every case
receving the full fees for adoption related petitions twice. If you feel you must
raise these fees in order to remain constant with inflation, then you need to help
those of us that are already spending exhorbiant amounts of our hard-earned
money to give an orphaned child a home by extending the length that our adoption-
related petitions remain active to 24 months, or at the very least, reduce the cost
of filing a second time.

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Sally Bromenshenk
